SENT.plain: Cap-assisted endoscopic mucosal resection enables nonsurgical removal of superficial esophageal lesions
Perforation at the resection site is a rare but known complication of this technique
We report a case in which traumatic insertion of the mucosectomy cap led to perforation of the cervical esophagus
This complication has not been previously reported
The perforation was successfully closed by the endoscopic placement of clips
